title: Knowing and Remembering: Cognitive and Neural Influences of Familiarity on Recognition Memory in Early Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: Unrandomized, unblinded, monocentric comparative Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging study.
description_detailed: Prospective functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging study involving a group of participants with Mild Cognitive Impairment due to AD and a control participants group matched for age, education level, verbal Intelligence Quotient as assessed through the French version of the National Adult Reading Test and income group following National Institute of Statistics and Economics Studies classification.
explanation_target: Reason: The study title and brief description identify this as an unrandomized, unblinded, monocentric functional MRI (fMRI) study examining how familiarity influences recognition memory in early Alzheimer's disease — a neuroimaging / cognitive investigation, not a drug trial. citeturn0search2

Act: I checked the trial registry entry (registration NCT02492529, lead sponsor Rennes University Hospital). The listed interventions are 'Neuropsychological tests', 'A cranial MRI', and 'Experimental procedure' — no pharmacologic agent or placebo is described, confirming there is no drug being tested. citeturn0search0turn0search2

Act (supporting literature): Related published fMRI studies of familiarity and associative/recollection memory in early AD focus on cognitive/neural mechanisms (examples: item familiarity vs associative retrieval and fMRI investigations of prior-knowledge effects), reinforcing that this line of work is neuroimaging/cognitive rather than pharmacologic. citeturn0search1turn0search5

Reflect: Given the intervention types and study aims, this trial does not fit the defined therapeutic categories (disease-targeted biologic, disease-targeted small molecule, cognitive enhancer, or neuropsychiatric symptom improvement). It is a diagnostic / cognitive-neuroscience fMRI study, so the correct classification is 'N/A'. No drug information was found because none is involved per the registry entry. citeturn0search2

Web search results (sources found): 1) Clinical trial registry entry for 'Knowing and Remembering...' (NCT02492529) — MedPath summary and details showing interventions as neuropsychological tests and MRI. citeturn0search2 2) MedPath trial detail page summarizing trial status and description. citeturn0search0 3) PubMed article: 'Item familiarity and controlled associative retrieval in Alzheimer's disease: an fMRI study' — example of related cognitive fMRI work. citeturn0search1 4) PubMed / journal article: 'Building memories on prior knowledge: behavioral and fMRI evidence of impairment in early Alzheimer's disease' — another related fMRI study of familiarity/prior knowledge in early AD. citeturn0search5
